pullRequest.body:
Rewrite results about artinian rings using `MaximalSpectrum` and `PrimeSpectrum` instead of sets `{I | I.IsMaximal}` and `{I | I.IsPrime}`.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

</summary>

| Mathlib.RingTheory.Artinian.Instances | 1262 | 1266 | +4 (+0.32%) |

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.FieldTheory.AxGrothendieck` `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Ring.Definability` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Nullstellensatz`</details>|1|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.Etale.Field` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Jacobson.Ring` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Regular.RegularSequence` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Unramified.Field`</details>|3|
|<details><summary>37 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.CartanExists` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.CartanMatrix` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.CartanSubalgebra` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Character` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Classical` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Derivation.AdjointAction` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Derivation.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Derivation.Killing` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.EngelSubalgebra` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Engel` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.InvariantForm` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Killing` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.LieTheorem` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Matrix` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Nilpotent` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Normalizer` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Quotient` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Rank` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.SkewAdjoint` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Sl2` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.TraceForm` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.Cartan` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.Chain` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.Killing` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.Linear` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Weights.RootSystem` `Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.JointEigenspace` `Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.Semisimple` `Mathlib.FieldTheory.JacobsonNoether` `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Algebra.LeftInvariantDerivation` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Eigenspace.Semisimple` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Eigenspace.Zero` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.JordanChevalley` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Semisimple` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Artinian.Instances` `Mathlib.RingTheory.FiniteLength`</details>|4|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Semisimple.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Semisimple.Defs` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Solvable`</details>|6|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.DirectSum`|21|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Free` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.UniversalEnveloping`|27|
|<details><summary>13 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Jordan.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Abelian` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.BaseChange` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Extension` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.IdealOperations` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.OfAssociative` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Subalgebra` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.Submodule` `Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.TensorProduct` `Mathlib.Algebra.Symmetrized` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Artinian.Module` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Artinian.Ring` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Derivation.Lie`</details>|28|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ equivSubtype`
`+ instance : Finite (MaximalSpectrum R)`
`+ nilradical_eq_iInf`
`+ primeSpectrumEquivMaximalSpectrum`
`+ primeSpectrumEquivMaximalSpectrum_comp_asIdeal`
`+ primeSpectrumEquivMaximalSpectrum_symm_comp_asIdeal`
`+ primeSpectrum_asIdeal_range_eq`
`+ setOf_isMaximal_finite`
`+ setOf_isPrime_finite`
`++ range_asIdeal`
`- maximal_ideals_finite`
`- primeSpectrum_finite`
`- subtype_isMaximal_finite`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/30a74741-23e1-4d60-a3ac-3180329b33ec) for commit d7129619fb53b331bb8ffe74f6c6c82164afa397.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
Do we still need this?

I thought it could be useful if someone needs to use subtype instead of `MaximalSpectrum`. I think leaving it is harmless but if the community agree that we should switch to using only `MaximalSpectrum` maybe it's worth removing.
Ok, I'll remove, it's easy to do just `(maximal_ideals_finite R).to_subtype`...

Hm... after trying it becomes:
```lean4
instance : Finite (PrimeSpectrum R) :=
  haveI : Finite {I : Ideal R // I.IsPrime} := (prime_ideals_finite R).to_subtype
  .of_equiv _ (PrimeSpectrum.equivSubtype _).symm
```
so the type is required anyway. Should I proceed with removing?
I think this is the only place where we will need this instance.

You mean `instance : Finite (PrimeSpectrum R)` (and for maximal as well)? Or `lemma subtype_isMaximal_finite : Finite {I : Ideal R // I.IsMaximal}`? I think both might be reusable outside at some point.
I'm referring to the latter. Providing the latter in mathlib seems to encourage people to use `{I : Ideal R // I.IsMaximal}` instead of `MaximalSpectrum R` but we wouldn't want this.
Ok, will remove then.

```suggestion
def primeSpectrumEquivMaximalSpectrum : PrimeSpectrum R ≃ MaximalSpectrum R where
```
Definitions should be in camel case.

```suggestion
    MaximalSpectrum.asIdeal ∘ primeSpectrum_equiv_maximalSpectrum =
```

```suggestion
    PrimeSpectrum.asIdeal.comp primeSpectrum_equiv_maximalSpectrum.symm =
```

If we have `range PrimeSpectrum.asIdeal = { I : I.IsPrime }` and the maximal ideal version, this lemma could be proved by `simp only [PrimeSpectrum.range_asIdeal, MaximalSpectrum.range_asIdeal, isPrime_iff_isMaximal]`
Do we still need this?
Same comments as for maximal.

```suggestion
  Ideal.Quotient.field I.asIdeal
```
Not tested
Works.

```suggestion
theorem range_asIdeal : Set.range MaximalSpectrum.asIdeal = {J : Ideal R | J.IsMaximal} :=
```
We name lemmas in the order they appear in the goal. And usually we only describe the LHS and omit the `eq` unless it is necessary for disambiguation.
I think you can revert these changes now?

```suggestion
/-- The prime spectrum is in bijection with the maximal spectrum. -/
```

```suggestion
lemma primeSpectrumEquivMaximalSpectrum_comp_asIdeal :
    MaximalSpectrum.asIdeal ∘ primeSpectrumEquivMaximalSpectrum =
      PrimeSpectrum.asIdeal (R := R) := rfl

lemma primeSpectrumEquivMaximalSpectrum_symm_comp_asIdeal :
```

```suggestion
lemma setOf_isPrime_finite : {I : Ideal R | I.IsPrime}.Finite := by
```

```suggestion
theorem nilradical_eq_iInf : nilradical R = iInf asIdeal := by
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Artinian): rewrite results using spectra types instead of sets
